page.title: 01LANDSCAPE OF KIP VALLEY
page.content: The land in this area runs from the {Firth of Clyde}at Lunderston Bay eastwards through moorland and a large U-shaped valley. Running along the shore is a raised beach about 1/4Km wide which provides a flat coastal plain. The area north of the valley rises to 130m and is used for rough grazing and forestry with a small housing area. Running through the valley is the{A78}trunk road and a railway line. On the valley floor industry and education are found in the form of an{International Business {Machines}factory and{Greenock High {School.} The south side of the valley rises to 200m. Running along the top of the valley is a man-made aqueduct, known as "the Cut", which formerly supplied water to{Greenock.} Surrounding it is an area of moorland.
